item.title: How to Effect Long-Lasting Organizational Changes
item.description:
Change is hard.

But sometimes, it’s simply unavoidable — in life and in organizations. Take remote work: not long ago, many companies dismissed it entirely. Today, they’re drafting work-from-home policies they never imagined needing.

Change will happen — with or without us. But what turns it into lasting success?

item.title: What is a Social Entrepreneur?
item.description:
Today, social entrepreneurship is defined in many ways — an ambiguity that can blur social entrepreneurs’ identity, undermine their credibility, weaken the relevance of the guidance they receive, and ultimately hinder their impact. That’s why a shared definition is essential.

This article shares my perspective and insights into social entrepreneurs, drawn from primary research conducted on a small random sample in Toronto, Canada.

item.title: Debt and SMEs in New Zealand
item.description:
In this video, I dive into debt funding for small to medium businesses in New Zealand. While the headlines often talk about how “cheap” money is — especially for homeowners — the reality for SMEs is quite different.

I’ll explore what current lending conditions mean for small businesses and share recommendations to help improve access to funding.

item.title: The Cloudy Relationship Between France and Diesel
item.description: After WWII, Charles de Gaulle jumpstarted the French economy by cutting diesel taxes for the first time — supporting the hauliers, farmers, and artisans who relied on it.
